location: The Ohio State University - Columbus, OH 43210
description: Construct I/O builds on last year’s successful Startup Midwest. Hear from industry operators at leading software companies and the latest in building on platforms across AI, low code, business intelligence, and more.

OHI/O and TEDxOhioStateUniversity are coming together for a collaborative event focusing on demystifying hackathons, and why they are such valuable learning experiences.
Bio-Hack is a healthcare-focused hackathon where students practice their teamwork skills, technical application, and innovative thinking
Capture the Flag (CTF) is a hacking competition in which teams compete to obtain “flags” by solving security-based problems

Data I/O is a free one day hackathon concentrated on practice with data and analytical tools while collaborating with peers, professors, and professionals. Projects range from AI to predictive algorithms, data visualization, and/or actionable insights
HackOHI/O is Ohio's largest hackathon and our flagship event. Check out our tenth year of building and creating awesome things.

Code I/O is a free computer-science workshop for girl students ages 10 - 15. The workshop aims to enable students to see the power and fun of programming. Activities include interactive programming with Scratch, hands-on introduction to web development, and real-life applications of Computer Science.

On February 26th, join us at High School I/O—a one day hackathon for high schoolers hosted by OHI/O, Ohio State's hackathon program. We aim to provide high school students an opportunity to learn about computer science in a fun, engaging, and inclusive environment.

LOGI OHI/O is a business strategy case competition and new venture of the Math department that seeks to strengthen the existing connection between firms, planning students, alumni and professional practitioners.

From the same folks that brought you 2017's HackOHI/O came 2018's biggest and best hardware event at The Ohio State University. A makeathon is a 24-hour hardware-oriented hackathon where students come together to create something amazing!
HackOHI/O is the Ohio State University's largest hackathon, and our flagship event. Check out our fifth year of building and creating real projects with awesome people.
High School I/O invites high school students to learn about computer science in a fun, engaging and inclusive environment by participating in a one day hackathon.

The dedication that students put into their tech projects both in and out of the classroom is what drives the amazing tech culture at Ohio State. ShowOHI/O is a showcase event to give students the opportunity to demo their work and network with Columbus tech and analytics professionals. Photos from the event!
Check out this year's biggest and best hardware event at The Ohio State University. Build something amazing!

Join us at at Ohio State's largest annual hackathon, powered by AWS. Over 700 undergraduate and graduate students will design, build, and demonstrate projects to a live audience of students, faculty, and representatives from tech companies.

From the same folks that brought you Makeathon 2015 and OHI/O 2015 comes this year’s best hardware event. Make something new, amazing and fun with a group of friends at our 24-hour hardware-focused hackathon.

OHI/O 2015 is a 24-hour hackathon that brings together over 500 students from over 30 schools and a variety of disciplines to build working projects. 23 sponsors joined us from around the nation, along with mentors and judges from Ohio State’s faculty, alumni, and industry partners.
